item.title: Soulmask: How to Get Cotton
item.description:
Quick Links

  • What Does Cotton Do In Soulmask?
  • Cotton Locations In Soulmask

Soulmask is a survival game (which takes after some of the most influential survival games) that will have players searching all over the game's world in order to find specific resources so that they can build and craft specific items. These resources can drastically increase the chance of survival, making them invaluable in the game.

One extremely useful resource is cotton (just like clay). This is one that can be a little difficult to find at first, but once players know where to look, they can find a ton of it all over the world. This resource not only allows players to craft items, but it is also something that can be planted. Here's how to find and use cotton.

What Does Cotton Do In Soulmask?

Cotton is an item that allows players to craft specific items. It can make yarn and course cotton, both of which can be vital to making important items later on in the game. To unlock this, players will need to unlock the Technology that is associated with cotton. Once they have the farming mechanics unlocked, players can even plant cotton, allowing them to harvest the plant in their own areas. Once they have been planted, players just need to approach them and press E to harvest them once they have grown.

Cotton Locations In Soulmask

Finding cotton in the game can be really challenging; in fact, players probably won't find it until they are a decent amount of time into the game. Cotton can be found growing around Barbarian Camps and Barbarian Barracks (the two triangle symbols in the picture above). Additionally, they can find cotton seeds in these areas that will allow them to plant them in their own bases to harvest later on. It is important to note that these areas can be difficult to clear out, meaning it isn't something a very low-level character should do.

The other area where cotton can be found is in the Ancient Ruins scattered around the game (the first symbol in the picture above). Here, cotton can be found in the chests that are all around the Ancient Ruins. However, it is not a guaranteed method of obtaining cotton, so don't count on it. Cotton is just one of the many items that can appear in the chests in these areas. For a guaranteed chance of obtaining it, players will want to head to the Barbarian Camps and Barbarian Barracks around the game.

item.title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A Will Have a Hard Time Topping One Aspect of its Predecessor
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon Legends: Z-A aims to continue breaking away from traditional Pokemon games with new mechanics and a unique storyline.
  • The game challenges players with unexpected plot twists, like the revelation of a friendly character's dark ambitions.
  • To stay ahead of the curve, Pokemon Legends: Z-A may focus on developing a complex main villain rather than relying on surprise twists.

Pokemon has always been about capturing and befriending monsters to do battle with. When it's time to encounter other trainers, they are rarely known to provide much challenge, let alone twists and turns to the plot of the game. In this aspect, Pokemon Legends: Arceus stood out from the rest of the series, so much so that it's hard to imagine Pokemon Legends: Z-A being able to top it.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A is the upcoming sequel to Pokemon Legends: Arceus . The Pokemon Legends series so far tends to break away from other mainline Pokemon games in a variety of ways. For example, Legends: Arceus is set in the distant past of Diamond and Pearl 's Sinnoh region, known then as the Hisui region. Likewise, Pokemon battles are completely different in Legends: Arceus thanks to mechanics never seen before or since. Using the new battle system and this story premise, the game was able to present players with one of the best fights in the entire series.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A Has Big Shoes to Fill

Pokemon is undoubtedly a series full of traditions, for better or for worse. There are plenty of aspects of the series that continue to be timeless, and some others which have felt dated for years. A great example of the latter is Pokemon 's narrative simplicity. Villains vary from gangsters stealing other people's Pokemon, to maniacs that want to destroy the world. Of course, this doesn't mean there's absolutely no depth in Pokemon 's villains, but it's always pretty clear who the bad guy is supposed to be.

Pokemon's Most Dramatic Twist

Yet again, Legends: Arceus was able to break new ground. Legends: Arceus takes place in the distant past, and features many characters who are meant to be the ancestors of other characters in the series. Early on, players are introduced to Volo, an eccentric merchant. From his design, to his team, to his interest in ancient artifacts, it's immediately clear that Volo is meant to be an ancestor of Cynthia, one of Pokemon 's most popular characters.

Cynthia is the champion of the Sinnoh region, and she is infamous for being one of the most difficult boss fights in the series. Despite the challenge she presented, she was a competent ally of the player. Similar to his descendant, Volo seems like a friendly guide to the player, even resembling the rivals of any other Pokemon game.

The Toughest Fight in Pokemon's History

That is, until players have fulfilled his request to collect the plates of Arceus. At that point, Volo reveals he has been manipulating the player for his own dark ambitions. Volo's team imitates Cynthia's, meaning he poses quite a challenge by himself. The stakes skyrocket when he does the unthinkable and summons Giratina thanks to the work the player did for him.

Pokemon may not be known for complicated storylines, but it certainly isn't known for being very difficult either. With a few notable exceptions, players can work with a great degree of freedom, and little effort to beat their opponents. Volo couldn't be more different. Players had to use plenty of preparation and strategy if they wanted to even stand a chance at beating Volo and Giratina.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A Lost the Element of Surprise

Twist villains are incredibly hard to pull off. Pokemon Legends: Arceus had the benefit of a decades-long history of straightforward storytelling behind it. Even with the growing complexity in recent Pokemon games, nobody was expecting the friendly character who had guided them the whole game to have such a sudden heel turn.

This puts Game Freak in a tricky situation. After all, lightning never strikes the same place twice. If Legends: Z-A was going to use a similar plot twist, it would be immediately obvious hours before the reveal. The reason the twist worked with Volo was that it was so unprecedented.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A Will Have to Innovate Yet Again

If Legends: Z-A wants to avoid being upstaged by its predecessor, the easiest solution is to refrain from trying its hand at another end-game twist villain. Instead, in the spirit of the Legends series, Pokemon Legends: Z-A will have to try a new direction. Rather than intending to shock the player, Pokemon Legends: Z-A can focus on the depth of its main villain. Pokemon isn't known for its complex stories, but maybe Pokemon Legends: Z-A could change that too.

item.title: Grand Theft Auto – The Best Quotes From San Andreas
item.description:
Highlights

  • San Andreas is hailed as the greatest GTA game with fantastic characters and iconic dialogue that makes it a classic.
  • CJ's humorous dialogue adds depth to his character, showcasing his wit and charm throughout the game's storyline.
  • The unforgettable quotes from characters like Woozie, Big Smoke, and Tenpenny highlight the humor and satire in the game.

Arguably the greatest of all the Grand Theft Auto games, GTA: San Andreas is still as fresh as it was in 2004, especially with the updated graphics of the re-release of the game. The original 3D trilogy of GTA is the building block of the current iteration of the franchise, and San Andreas is the culmination of said trilogy. It offers a perfect blend of open-world exploration, cheesy humor, and over-the-top action — in essence, everything Grand Theft Auto stands for.

One of the central components to its success as a Grand Theft Auto game is its fantastic characters. Every character is iconic and memorable, but what ties each character to their performance is their dialogue. The writing for Grand Theft Auto games has always been stellar, but there is something about San Andreas that really shines. Which are the best GTA: San Andreas quotes ?

Updated on June 7, 2024, by Ritwik Mitra: When people talk about amazing writing in video games, it's only a matter of time before Rockstar Games steps into the picture. Even during a time when the studio wasn't known for its visual fidelity, it was clear from the get-go that the amazing writing in the company's games made each cutscene worth checking out, with certain titles featuring a wealth of amazing voice talent that made every scene come to life. The fact that San Andreas' voice cast included stars like Charlie Murphy and Samuel L. Jackson is a testament to the amazing quality of the game's writing, which is a huge reason why a major chunk of the game is so quotable.

23 "I Hate Gravity!"

Carl 'CJ' Johnson

  • If CJ is falling from a height that will kill him

CJ is a joy to control, with this character's relentless quips showcasing his comic chops and making it easy for players to resonate with him. His personality is in-your-face without being too overbearing, and because he's so easy to like, players will certainly want to ensure that he's able to get revenge for the betrayal he faced as a member of Grove Street.

That being said, CJ is also a GTA protagonist who is at the mercy of the player, and those who want to check out just how much damage this character can sustain may make him jump from great heights to see what his limits are. If players bite off more than they can chew, CJ may shout out this hilarious line before being sent on a trip to the hospital.

22 "Yeah... Can I F**k Your Sister?"

Eddie Pulaski

  • Pulaski's last words before CJ snuffs his life out for good

Pulaski, along with Tenpenny and Jimmy Hernandez, make CJ's life a living hell from the very moment he comes back to Los Santos. The members of C.R.A.S.H. are cops who are corrupt to their core, and most players were likely quite glad when they were given a chance to take out this cocky member of the trio after Tenpenny knocks Hernandez out for being a snitch.

The officer tasks CJ with digging both his and Jimmy's graves, but the latter wakes up and bungles up the plan. Pulaski legs it, but CJ catches up and mortally wounds the corrupt officer, who makes one last dig at CJ's sister before suffering a brutal stomp to the head that ends his life for good. For his last works, Pulaski could've chosen something more poignant and less crass, but that wouldn't have been in line with his degenerate personality.

21 "I Have A Confession To Make... I Am... I'm Blind."

Wu Zi Mu, AKA Woozie

  • Stating something that was obvious from the get-go in a hilarious moment

Getting in touch with Woozie makes for one of the best moments in GTA San Andreas . Just when players thought they'd played through the best part of the game, Woozie's unique personality and hilarious dialogue make it clear that the title still has a lot more to offer than what meets the eye. Some of the best moments in the game come when Woozie and Carl interact with each other.

These simple dialogue exchanges are a blast to experience, and hearing Woozie seriously talk about the fact that he's blind when this has been crystal-clear for the past few missions is a great example of why this game is such a beloved classic. CJ isn't really lost for words a lot of the time, but the straight-faced nature with which Woozie utters this ludicrous statement catches him off-guard.

20 "Damn! The Devious B*stards Have Changed The Layout!"

Wu Zi Mu, AKA Woozie

  • Realizing that relying on the layouts he'd memorized for a base were faulty after running into a wall

Despite his lack of vision, Woozie proves time and time again that he's a force to be reckoned with during tense combat scenarios. The mere fact that he can somehow wield a gun and hit targets shows just how good his other sensory skills are, letting him pull his weight during shootouts instead of being completely useless. However, that doesn't stop Rockstar from having some fun at his expense.

A great example of this is during a mission where Woozie brags about how he's mapped out the base of an opposing Triad gang. His confidence is so infectious that players genuinely believe that this genius has managed to achieve the impossible. That is until he runs into a brick wall and is knocked down immediately. Hearing him curse the rival gang members for changing the layout is a genuine laugh-out-loud moment and shows just how much fun the people over at Rockstar were having when they wrote the script of this legendary game.

19 "Now, I Know You Blind Man... But You Gotta See This!"

Carl 'CJ' Johnson

  • A comical line that CJ says to Woozie, knowing that the man is blind

CJ is certainly one of the most enthusiastic and capable protagonists of all time. He can drive a bike, plane, and car like it's second nature to him, even if he can be a bit reckless at times. He's also the first Grand Theft Auto protagonist to be able to swim — a fact that most people take for granted nowadays but was a huge deal back in the day. Finally, despite what most people may assume, he's quite intelligent and can form some great plans that utilize his strengths to take out any enemy that stands in his way.

Such is the case when he devises a plan to carry out a heist. The man is so excited that he utters one of the most quotable lines in the entire game to start out this cutscene, setting the stage for an epic mission.

18 "Do I Look Like A Gangster? I’m A Businessman!"

Carl 'CJ' Johnson

  • Stated when Carl is loaded while being chased by the cops

CJ has so many funny quips throughout the series that it's impossible not to mention some of them. One particularly notable line comes when he's loaded and is being chased by the cops.

CJ will feign innocence despite committing numerous atrocities, straight up saying that he's a businessman and not a gangster. Not only is this line pretty hilarious, but it's also pretty cool that the game takes CJ's economic situation into account when deciding which line he would say, too.

17 "I'm Blind, Carl... Not Stupid."

Wu Zi Mu, AKA Woozie

  • A hilarious retort after CJ states that he's black

Woozie being blind isn't revealed until some time passes with this character across several missions. It's played for laughs several times, including this particular instance when Carl asks if Woozie knows whether he's black or not.

This prompts Woozie to utter this memorable line, showing why so many characters love this Triad boss. Watching his friendship with Carl blossom also makes this one of the more memorable interactions in San Andreas .

16 "I Am The Real Deal Fool, Oh, Yeah. A Genius."

Lance 'Ryder' Wilson

  • Ryder is pretty cocky, and this line highlights that side of his personality

It's a shame that Ryder ended up betraying the GSF since he was genuinely one of the funniest characters in the gang. Missions with him were a blast, even if he did insult CJ more often than not during certain scenarios.

During one of these cutscenes, Ryder asks CJ why he never finished high school. Despite CJ's barrage of funny insults that follow, it's Ryder who takes the cake in this scene by proclaiming himself to be a genius who was too intelligent for high school in the first place, which is the best dialogue to show what Ryder is all about.

15 "What Did You Expect? It's America!"

Carl 'CJ' Johnson

  • Meant to be a parody of gun laws in America

There's no denying that gun control laws are the subject of widespread debate in America. So, it's funny to see that the GTA series lampoons this situation whenever CJ threatens someone with a gun.

Hearing the main character say this line with the highest level of confidence makes for a hilarious time indeed. GTA never shies away from satirizing America in many ways, and this line is no exception.

14 "All You Little Men Are Scared Of Strong Women! If We're Passionate, You Say We're Crazy. If We're Upset, You Say We're Hysterical."

Catalina

  • Trying to hide behind her craziness by bringing misplaced feminism into the mix

Catalina is one of the funniest characters in San Andreas despite not being around for too long. Before running off with Claude, the protagonist of GTA 3 , she pretty much forces herself into a relationship with CJ after he's kicked out of Los Santos.

Her crazy persona is used for several laughs throughout the series, with CJ getting exasperated time and time again. Fans were both glad and saddened to see her leave CJ, even if it was done in a pretty cool way to set up the events of GTA 3 .

13 "The Russians Got Bigger Things To Worry About Than Your Genitals, Believe Me."

Mike Toreno

  • A government agent who uses Carl to further his mission, forcing him into dangerous situations

Mike is a great side character and one that nicely rounds out San Andreas ’s nutty plot. Mike is a G-man through and through, and his biting humor is the perfect addition to the cast of nutjobs that irritate CJ.

Voiced by James Woods, Mike is as sarcastic and pessimistic as one would expect a government spook to be, but his views of America fit right in with the world of San Andreas .

12 "Don’t Blame Me, Blame Society."

Carl 'CJ' Johnson

  • Uttered when CJ is causing havoc in the city streets

CJ might be the snarkiest of the GTA protagonists, although it’s hard to pick just one. He is quick to shift the blame onto others in most scenarios, which is perhaps a sign of his own immaturity, but he’s still pretty darn funny, even when he is blasting away rival gang members.

A part of CJ’s rogue charm is his tendency to lash out against authority figures, or in this case, society as a whole. This quote can be heard when CJ engages in combat, and it does an excellent job at defining his character.

11 "Make Sure It's The Right Guy This Time!"

Helicopter Pilot

  • A hilarious dig at real-life police and their tendency to shoot the wrong person

The helicopter pilots always have something to say. In each GTA game, they have a different persona going on, all united by their bloodthirsty hate for the player. Because of this, shooting them out of the sky makes for an incredibly fun activity.

In San Andreas , the chopper pilots are a pair of bumbling goofs, arguably the most comedic of all the pilots in the series. This quote is uttered when they fire upon CJ. It is a disturbing yet silly line that highlights the powder keg tone in which GTA police are portrayed.

10 "You Picked The Wrong House, Fool!"

Melvin 'Big Smoke' Harris

  • The first and most memorable line uttered by Big Smoke when Carl goes back to his mother's house

As one of the central antagonists in San Andreas , Big Smoke delivers some of the most iconic quotes in the GTA series. When CJ returns home, he finds quite a lot has changed around the old neighborhood, least of all his friend Big Smoke, who believes him to be a robber before uttering this now classic line.

Big Smoke may be an intimidating guy, but he sure can be funny when an opportunity arises. Once he realizes CJ is not a burglar, he embraces his old friend, showing that he can be just as charming as he is violent.

9 "Just Like Old Times, Huh, Tommy?"

Ken Rosenberg

  • Mistaking CJ for Tommy after being drugged out of his mind

The original Grand Theft Auto trilogy was interlaced with self-references and crossover characters that helped build the world of GTA from the ground up. Ken Rosenberg is a central character in Vice City and a minor supporting character in San Andreas , which takes place several years after the former game.

When caught in the midst of a shootout, Ken accidentally calls CJ the name Tommy, the protagonist of Vice City . This is a nice callback to the previous title, and though it doesn't offer much information regarding Tommy's current activities, it's still a nice detail that connects both games.

8 "Ah S**t, Here We Go Again."

Carl 'CJ' Johnson

  • An iconic line said after Carl is chucked out of Tenpenny's police car

This quote spawned the meme itself and would be CJ’s catchphrase if he ever had one. CJ finds himself in the thick of it when he returns home to Los Santos after several years away. His old gang is in shambles, and it’s up to him to pick up the pieces.

CJ isn’t afraid to speak his mind, but he is also one to complain. This classic quote is iconic not only for the memes but for how it manages to encapsulate CJ’s personality in one swoop.

7 "Grove Street. Home."

Carl 'CJ' Johnson

  • After returning to the place he grew up in following news of his mother's death

For all the comedic tomfoolery in San Andreas , there is still a layer of seriousness that permeates the undercurrents of the game’s story. CJ abandoned his friends and family when they needed him most, and now he has to make amends.

CJ’s story is one of redemption and forgiveness, both of others and of the self. He can’t change the past, but he can change the future. Though this line suggests that he has given up on the idea of this, his actions throughout the rest of the game prove otherwise.

6 "Kid, I’m A Hippie. The Only Thing I’ve Shot Is Acid."

The Truth

  • A hilarious line from one of the most memorable characters in the series

The Truth, played by Peter Fonda of all people, is one of the funniest side characters in the game. An aged hippie who seems out of place in the world of San Andreas , The Truth actually meshes pretty well with CJ despite their differences in the realm of violence.

This goofball quote comes after CJ asks if Truth can shoot a gun, which he obviously cannot. Even in the mayhem of Grand Theft Auto , there is still a little sliver of room for peace and love.

5 "I Can S**t On You From Such A Height That You’ll Think God Himself Took A Crap On You!"

Frank Tenpenny

  • Tenpenny's sarcastic and flamboyant delivery is in full force here when he threatens Carl

Samuel L. Jackson nails every role he is in, but it’s always extra special when he plays the antagonist. Needless to say, he kills it in the role of corrupt cop Officer Tenpenny, a cruel and manipulative police officer who causes trouble for CJ around every turn.

This quote from the scheming narc is just one of his many great one-liners in the game, delivered with vigor and rage. As far as villains in Grand Theft Auto go, Tenpenny is as hilarious as they come, even if he is still a malicious monster.

4 “I’m A Well-Dressed Maniac”

Carl 'CJ' Johnson

  • If players have expensive threads on while causing rampant violence in the city streets

At the end of the day, Grand Theft Auto is about uber violence and crime in America. The decision may fall on the player in terms of how violent they are, but CJ is more than willing to go along with any potential rampage.

When shooting, CJ will shout out various threats, but there is something about this particular one that feels ridiculously Grand Theft Auto . Mentioning his stylish clothes during a rampage is something that only CJ would do.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail 2.3 Livestream Redeem Codes
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Honkai: Star Rail 2.3 Livestream Redeem Codes
  • How To Redeem Honkai: Star Rail Codes
  • Stellar Jade In Honkai: Star Rail

Honkai: Star Rail is developed by HoYoverse, the maker of Genshin Impact . This gacha game is a turn-based strategy RPG that's set in the Honkai universe, although it’s not a sequel to Honkai Impact 3rd .

Similar to Genshin Impact which often has some codes, Honkai: Star Rail also features some redeem codes for people to claim on launch day. This article will feature HSR redeem codes , how to redeem them, and other items players will get to begin their Trailblazing journey.

Updated on June 7, 2024, by Nahda Nabiilah : After many ups and downs in the dreamland of Penacony, players can finally see the ending of the arc in version 2.3. In the upcoming HSR update, Trailblazers will also have the chance to get Firefly and Jade from the Warp banners. Jade is a completely new persona, only previously known through her position as one of the Ten Stonehearts. On the other hand, Firefly left quite an impact on many players after the journey Trailblazers go through with her, so she's currently more favored than Jade.

Honkai: Star Rail 2.3 Livestream Redeem Codes

These are the HSR 2.3 livestream codes:

  • 3AJUD36P766B (100 Stellar Jades + 50k Credit)
  • DA3VV367PP7X (100 Stellar Jades + 5 Traveler's Guide)
  • QB3DC36PP673 (100 Stellar Jades + 4 Refined Aether)

Players can also exchange the following Honkai: Star Rail redeem codes for June 2024:

  • FA2CU3P7P6QT (50 Stellar Jades, 10k Credit)
  • HSRGFN24 (3 Traveler's Guide, 3 Condensed Aether, 30k Credit)
  • LOVEFROMROBIN (10k Credit, 3 Firmament Note)
  • VAJEGY4MNMDK (50 Stellar Jades, 10k Credit)
  • ROBININSIDE (10k Credit, 2 Adventure Log)
  • STARRAILGIFT (50 Stellar Jades)

Expired Codes

  • HSR1YEAR (5k Credit, 1 All or Nothing)
  • 0327CARNIVAL (5k Credit, 2 "Sour Dreams" Soft Candy)

How To Redeem Honkai: Star Rail Codes

To redeem the HSR codes, log in to the Honkai: Star Rail redeem code website https://hsr.hoyoverse.com/gift, then manually input the codes, or simply press on the link to open the redemption site with the code automatically attached to it .

Players should ensure they already made an account before trying to redeem. Otherwise, the website won't find the desired profile.

Alternatively, once players unlock the in-game menu, there will be a Redemption Code button under Trailblazer Profile , which can be accessed by pressing the menu button next to their MC's name.

Stellar Jade In Honkai: Star Rail

Stellar Jade is the primary currency for Honkai: Star Rail players. In Genshin Impact , it’s equivalent to Primogems, which means people will use it for gacha (called Warp in HSR) and to recover 60 Trailblaze Power, up to eight times per day. Just like in Genshin Impact , each Warp will cost 160 Stellar Jades, and there are two types of Warping currencies; Star Rail Pass and Star Rail Special Pass . The former is used for Standard Warp, while the latter is for Limited Banner, which includes Honkai: Star Rail Seele.

The game features a Beginner Banner for new players, which allows people to gain 50 Warp at the cost of 40. A guaranteed 5-star will also be rewarded after all 40 pulls are performed.

item.title: Insomniac’s Venom Game Won’t Have to Deal With One Marvel’s Wolverine Challenge
item.description:
When it was released in 2018, Marvel’s Spider-Man delivered what many would consider the definitive Spider-Man experience, which has only improved with the release of Marvel’s Spider-Man: Miles Morales and Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 . When it comes to superhero action titles, Insomniac is perhaps the best in the game right now, and the upcoming Marvel's Wolverine has fans eagerly waiting. There's still no hard release date since the first Marvel's Wolverine teaser trailer dropped back in 2021.

Insomniac may have formally announced Marvel’s Wolverine , but after an unfortunate data breach late last year, the public became aware that it's also working on a Venom game, likely spinning off from the character’s appearance in Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 . While these are massively exciting for fans, they represent a unique task for the developers of making engaging, challenging gameplay for characters that are practically invincible.

What Are Venom’s Weaknesses?

Venom and Wolverine are both functionally bullet-proof, with the former’s symbiote negating the damage outright and the latter's ability to rapidly heal from damage with his advanced regenerative healing factor. But unlike Logan, Venom's numerous symbiotic abilities come with baked in weaknesses that the devs can exploit to create a more challenging gaming experience.

Venom has always had two core weaknesses: sonics and fire. And though Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 indicates that Insomniac’s Venom doesn’t share his comic counterpart’s vulnerability to fire, sonic weaponry can still pose a serious threat to the Wicked Wall-Crawler. Enemies with Oscorp-branded sonic blasters can appear all over the city doing massive damage to the player in a way that the average street criminal just wouldn’t be able to approach.

That’s not even touching on the symbiote’s need to sustain itself. After the Tom Hardy Venom movies, the general public is very aware of the character's reliance on phenethylamine, a chemical found in chocolate and brains. Ultimate Spider-Man fans from back in the day will remember that Venom’s health bar would suffer a constant passive draining effect. The only way to combat this was to devour enemies or even innocent bystanders. This would be a great feature to bring back for the character’s first standalone game.

How Can the Venom Game Handle Marvel’s Spider-Man 2's Plot Twist?

Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 left off on a huge cliffhanger regarding Carnage, a character who’s arguably more of a Venom antagonist at this point in his long history. A story featuring a Carnage takeover of New York would be a perfect plot for a potential Venom game, as symbiote enemies are naturally able to harm each other and provide additional gameplay vulnerability for the character. This does, admittedly, run the risk of repetition of plot beats in the previous game, but it may also save the team some time working on new enemy models.

How Will Insomniac Handle Marvel’s Wolverine?

Logan is a little more difficult to adapt in a video game due to the fact a central part of his mutation is his inability to die. Bullets and edged weapons mean almost nothing to his healing factor, and he doesn’t have a kryptonite style weakness to exploit.

The most important thing to remember here is that there needs to be a challenge facing players. Controlling an invincible mutant killing machine seems fun at first, but without engaging gameplay, that experience will get old fast. The devs need to find a way to ensure the players actually face a loss condition. Despite this, other teams in the past have figured out a happy medium between keeping the power fantasy of being Wolverine and maintaining a respectable difficulty curve in-game.

Insomniac Should Take Notes From The Best Wolverine Game Yet

X-Men Origins: Wolverine from Raven Software is the most successful take on Wolverine in gaming. The hack-and-slash game is based on the film of the same name and features graphic depictions of Wolverine’s combat abilities and, more importantly, his healing factor.

The game gives the player two health bars: one representing Wolverine's exterior and his interior, respectively. Once the first bar is depleted, Logan will start taking damage to his internal organs, which will eventually put him out of commission. Getting out of combat for a few seconds would give both bars some time to regenerate, but this was probably the best take on Wolverine’s healing factor to-date. Given recent rumors that Insomniac is taking notes from Raven Software's real-time Wolverine healing/regeneration mechanics, the health system may be making a return as well.
